note.p: Death: Great Western Hotel, Paddington (24 July 1865)

Career: Assistant Surgeon, Bombay army (1811); Surgeon (1822); Physician General and President, Medical Board, Bombay (1842); retired (1843); Alderman, ward of Cheap, London (1853-1858); Sheriff of London (1855); Director, Royal British bank (opened 1849); Deputy Governor (November 1849 - January 1850); bank closed (1856); was tried before the Court of Queen's Bench, Guildhall for fraud, with 7 other directors (February 1858); sentenced to 9 months imprisonment, but released (July 1858)
